page.title: 03Strongford Sewage Works
page.content: Strongford sewage works treats most of the sewage from the City of Stoke-on Trent.The first stage of the process is to rake the sewage to get all the rags and things like that out.Then the grit has to be taken out.The water goes into another filter so that the grit and the sand can be removed.Next it needs the grease to be got out.There is an arm that collects all the grease and it is put into chambers.The organic waste is eaten by little bugs which are put into the water. Air is pumped into the water so that the bugs can survive.The sludge that is left is dried by sucking and squeezing out the water.The clean water then goes into the River Trent.There are now lots of fish in the river because the water is so clean.
